title: 105_hr4267
content: The Act titled "Timber-Dependent Counties Stabilization Act of 1998" allows for the sharing of forest service timber sale receipts. The Timber-Dependent Counties Stabilization Act of 1998 allows for special payments to States in lieu of the 25-percent payments for fiscal years 1999 through 2003, and after 2003, States can choose between the special payment amount or the 25-percent payments. The Timber-Dependent Counties Stabilization Act of 1998 allows States to choose between special payments or the 25-percent payments for fiscal years after 2003. The Governor must make the election within 5 years of the Act's enactment, or the State is deemed to have chosen the special payment. Amounts received must be spent as required for 25-percent payments to States. The "25-percent payments to States" refer to the 25 percent payments authorized by the Act of May 23, 1908 for counties with national forests. The "special payment amount" is determined by multiplying 76 percent by the annual average of the 25-percent payments to States made to the State during the 5-year period from fiscal years 1986 through 1990, adjusted for changes in the consumer price index for urban areas. The consumer price index for urban areas is adjusted for changes that occur after its publication for fiscal year 2003. SEC. 3. SHARING OF BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT TIMBER SALE RECEIPTS. In lieu of 50-percent payments to counties for fiscal years 1999 through 2003, the Secretary of the Treasury will pay each eligible county a special payment amount. For fiscal years after 2003, the Secretary will pay either the special payment amount or the 50-percent payments, as elected by the county. The chief executive officer of a county must elect to receive either the special payment amount or the 50-percent payments for fiscal years after 2003 within 5 years of the enactment of the Act. If no election is made, the county is deemed to have chosen the payment described in subparagraph (A)(i). The term "50-percent payments to counties" refers to the sum of the 50-percent share. The term "payments to counties" refers to the sum of the 50-percent share paid to a county under specific Acts. The term "special payment amount" is calculated by multiplying 76 percent by the annual average of 50-percent payments made to counties during a specified 5-year period, adjusted for inflation. The consumer price index for urban areas changes after its publication for fiscal year 2003. Title XIII of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 is amended by removing chapter 4.
